intro: Prionotes, commonly known as the common prionotes, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. They typically produce showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink or white. Prionotes species are often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. They are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
